definitions.definition: Like this, that, these, those; used to make a comparison with something implied by context.
examples: I’ve never seen such clouds in the sky before.
Really? Unfortunately, my mind refuses to bring any such memory forward.
the above address or at such other address as may be provided

definitions.definition: Used as an intensifier roughly equivalent to very much (of) , quite or rather .
examples: Unfortunately, it wasn't such a good holiday as we thought it would.
The party was such a bore. "Bottomless" is such a lie.

subdefinitions.definition: Used with gradable noun phrases to form exclamations .
examples: Why, I was absolutely spellbound. She sings with such passion!

definitions.definition: A certain ; representing the object as already particularized in terms which are not mentioned.

main_definition: ( demonstrative ) Like this, that, these, those; used to make a comparison with something implied by context.
secondary_definitions: ( particularly used in formal documents ) Any.
( degree ) Used as an intensifier roughly equivalent to very much (of) , quite or rather .
( obsolete ) A certain ; representing the object as already particularized in terms which are not mentioned.
